page.title: 02SURVEY OF OPINIONS
page.content: We sent out a questionnaire to the parents in our school. We asked them questions about Murton. Here are some of their answers."Murton is a growing town that has lost its identity.Situated in County Durham, we have a Seaham post-code, a Hetton-le-Hole telephone code -this is a Tyne-and-Wear telephone area. Due to electoral boundary changes, Murton has gone from Easington Constituency to Houghton-le-Spring Constituency and now back to Easington. We lost our Police station, and are now under threat of losing the largest employer. The National Coal Board has closed Hawthorn Colliery and Murton colliery is reported to be touch and go.If the pit closes there is no other local industry."
